original: Cantell, Carl-August Nilsson-, lektor, Visby, f. 28/12/93 i Visby av sjö-kapt. August Nilsson o. Johanna Nilsson. G. 36 m. Gunborg Gustafsson. Barn: Carl-Erik f. 38, Margareta 42, Lennart 45. — Stud:ex. i Visby 12, fil kand. i Upps. 14, fil mag. 16, fil lic. 20, fil dr 21. E. o. lektor i Uddevalla 22-23, i Skövde 24-29, adj. i Landskrona 29-30, lektor i biol o. kemi i Vänersborg 30-36, i geogr. o. biol m. hälsolära v. Visby h. a. I sed. 36. Bedriv, tillika vet:skapl forskn. över havsdjur, spec. kräftdjursgrupp. Cirri-pedia, bearb. saml i in- o. uti. museer, bedriv, museistud. i Engl, Frankr., Tyskl, Holl, Belg. o. Ital Skr.: ett stort ant. vet:skapl avh., bl a. Cirri-’ pedstudier (Upps. 21), Cirripedier fr. Ind. Oceanen i mus. i Calcutta (Calcutta 38), pop :vet :skapl art. i tidn. o. tidskr. RNO, Kgl belg. med. f. vet:-skapl arb. 38.
translated: Carl-August Nilsson-Cantell, lecturer, Visby, born on 28/12/1893 in Visby to sea captain August Nilsson and Johanna Nilsson. Married in 1936 to Gunborg Gustafsson, with whom he had three children: Carl-Erik (born 1938), Margareta (born 1942), and Lennart (born 1945). He obtained his studentexamen (leaving certificate) in Visby in 1912, bachelor of arts in Uppsala in 1914, master of arts in 1916, licentiate degree in 1920, and a PhD in 1921. He was a temporary lecturer in Uddevalla from 1922-1923, in Skövde from 1924-1929, an adjunct teacher in Landskrona from 1929-1930, and a lecturer in biology and chemistry in Vänersborg from 1930-1936. He was also a lecturer in geography, biology, and health education in Visby from 1936. He engaged in scientific research on marine animals, specifically the crustacean group of Cirripedia, and compiled collections in museums. He conducted museum studies in England, France, Germany, Holland, Belgium and Italy. He wrote numerous scientific papers, including studies on Cirripedida (Uppsala 1921) and Cirripedians from the Indian Ocean in the museum in Calcutta (Calcutta 1938), as well as articles in various scientific magazines and journals. He was a member of the Royal Society of Sciences in Uppsala, Sweden, and the Royal Belgian Academy of Medicine and the Natural Sciences in Brussels, Belgium, where he contributed scientific work in 1938.

structured.description: Carl-August Nilsson-Cantell was an expert on marine animals, specifically the crustacean group of Cirripedia. He compiled collections in museums and conducted museum studies in England, France, Germany, Holland, Belgium and Italy. He wrote numerous scientific papers, including studies on Cirripedida and Cirripedians from the Indian Ocean in the museum in Calcutta, as well as articles in various scientific magazines and journals.
